column1: description
AIM: The NPC spends their turn aiming with a Ranged weapon. On their next turn, their attack hits automatically. Roll damage as usual.

BACKSTAB: Following a successful Stealth check, the NPC may use a knife to perform a powerful surprise attack, dealing an additional +1D10 damage to one enemy. Can only be used when not engaged in combat.
BASH: The NPC can choose to deal +1D10 damage with a melee weapon, but suffers –2 Defense for the next round.
CLEAVE: When wielding a two-handed melee weapon, all enemies adjacent to the NPC’s target also take half of the rolled damage.
COUP DE GRACE: Deals +D8 damage against knocked-down enemies.
DEFENSIVE: Gains +1 Defense.
DILIGENT MEDIC: The NPC may attempt to heal the same Wound twice per Time Track, instead of once.
FAST: Adds +1 to all Initiative rolls.
FIELD MEDIC: Advantage on all Medical Aid checks.
FRUGAL: The NPC can make each ration last 2 weeks instead of 1.
HACKING: With uncanny ease, the NPC can attempt to hack not only human computers but some Àrsaidh technology as well.
HARD TO KILL: Gains +1 max Wounds.
MARKSMAN: Deals +2 damage on ranged attacks.

MOMENTUM: As their action, the NPC attempts to eliminate a downed opponent. Their attack deals +D6 damage, and if the opponent is eliminated they gain +2 damage for the rest of the combat. This effect stacks with itself.
PACK MULE: The NPC perfectly arranges the things in their bag. Gain +4 Gear Slots.

RESUSCITATE: Within 1 minute after a character dies, the NPC may perform a Medical Aid check. If they roll an Impressive success or more, the character is revived, but remains unconscious for D10+10 hours with 1 Wound remaining.
STRONG: Deals +2 damage on all melee attacks.
TARGETED STRIKES: Gains +1 to all rolls on the Hit Location table.
TECH SAVVY: Advantage on all Technology checks.
TOUGH: Rolls Recovery checks with +2 WIL.
